paragraphs.content: Chapter 40
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 40

paragraphs.content: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Moreover the Lord answered Job, and said,

paragraphs.content: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Then Job answered the Lord, and said,

paragraphs.content: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

paragraphs.content: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Then answered the Lord unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

paragraphs.content: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

paragraphs.content: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

paragraphs.content: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

paragraphs.content: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

paragraphs.content: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

paragraphs.content: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

paragraphs.content: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

paragraphs.content: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

paragraphs.content: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

paragraphs.content: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

paragraphs.content: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

paragraphs.content: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

paragraphs.content: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

paragraphs.content: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

paragraphs.content: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

paragraphs.content: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
